snippet: Only 1 percent of voters have never heard of Mrs. Clinton, according to one poll, but this campaign she hopes to portray herself as a more personable candidate early on.
abstract: Polling experts and historians say Hillary Rodham Clinton is first contender for presidential nomination since Richard M Nixon in 1968 to have as widely recognized a name; Clinton is faced with challenge of changing voters' opinions of her, and she may opt to take few pages of out Nixon's playbook, such as touring country and engaging with mostly friendly audiences.
lead_paragraph: Only 1 percent of voters have never heard of Mrs. Clinton, according to one poll, but this campaign she hopes to portray herself as a more personable candidate early on.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton May Not Need a Second Chance to Make a First Impression
headline.print_headline: Needing No Introduction, Clinton Tries for Second Impression
